patterns.end: (?((?!\1))\)|(?=[")]))(?#Condition is true only when Backreference \1 from capture group 1 in "begin" is *not* empty.)
patterns.name: capture-group-modify

patterns.end: (?((?!\1))\)|(?=[")]))(?#Condition is true only when Backreference \1 from capture group 1 in "begin" is *not* empty.)
patterns.name: capture-group-modify-extended

capture-group-modify-options.comment: - i m x W D S P y{g} y{w}

capture-group-referencing.comment: 1 <2> '3' 1+0 <+2-0> '-3+0' 'name' <name+0> 'name-0'    Capture group soft limit is 999 and hard limit 32767    Level limit is 2147483647

For some reason (\G|...) and any of its variations are extremely performance heavy

character-class-literal.comment: Match anything left over and all non-meta charaters
character-class-literal.name: literal.tm regex

patterns.comment: For some reason (\G|...) and any of its variations are extremely performance heavy
patterns.name: invalid.illegal.tm markup.underline

patterns.comment: As soon as theres a {0} quantifier, all other quantifiers are nullified
patterns.//: Causes too much lag. -4x in some cases

patterns.comment:
+ * ? ++ +? *+ *? ?+ ?? 
  ? creates a lazy quantifier and + a possessive quantifier

character-types-2.comment: \. \N \O \R \X cannot be used in character classes
character-types-2.name: variable.other.enummember.tm

character-literal.comment: Match anything left over and all non-meta charaters
character-literal.name: entity.name.label.tm strong regex

invalid.comment: invalid: single escaped characters (including at newlines), rouge right brackets, unescaped double quotes and any invalid control characters
invalid.name: invalid.illegal.tm markup.underline regex

test.comment: Disable "character-literal" when running tests. As it will try to capture everything and leave nothing for "test". This can be done by simply renaming it.
test.name: keyword.control strong regex

patterns.match: (*FAIL) QabcE $ \$   an{name}bc  At aT aa abc abd cd a1 b a1b n1000 Q.E q.e test a<name0>b$abc
